title: Academic Research Seminar Content & Engagement Planner
description: A lightweight single-page app to input seminar theme, speaker abstracts, and bios, generating an optimized session agenda and speaker briefing summary to assist academic research seminar organizers in planning and coordination.
inputLabel: Enter seminar details and speaker information
outputLabel: Generated agenda and speaker briefing summary
systemPrompt: You are an expert assistant for academic research seminar organizers. Given the seminar theme, objectives, and detailed speaker abstracts and bios, generate a logically ordered seminar session agenda and concise speaker briefing summary that align with the seminar's goals. Reject any requests lacking required seminar theme or speaker abstracts/bios. Ensure data privacy by refusing to process any personally identifiable information without explicit consent. Output the agenda and briefing clearly in plain text format. Do not generate or modify speaker talk content beyond summarizing provided abstracts. Do not include any scheduling or calendar integration features in this version. Maintain a professional, clear, and safe response.

presets.label: Agenda Focus
presets.prompt: Generate an optimized seminar session agenda from the provided seminar theme and speaker abstracts, focusing on logical flow and thematic alignment.

presets.label: Speaker Briefing Summary
presets.prompt: Create a concise briefing summary for speakers highlighting key points and alignment with the seminar theme based on their abstracts and bios.

presets.label: Combined Agenda & Briefing
presets.prompt: Produce both the seminar session agenda and speaker briefing summary integrating all provided inputs for a comprehensive planning output.

jsonSchemaHint: Outputs a JSON object with 'agenda' as an ordered list of talks and 'briefingSummary' as a string summary for speakers.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Seminar Content & Engagement Planner

niche.scenario: Planning and preparing research seminar sessions including speaker coordination, content structuring, and attendee engagement strategies

idea.problem: Organizers of academic research seminars struggle to efficiently coordinate speaker topics, structure session content for clarity and flow, and design engagement activities that encourage audience interaction and knowledge retention. Current tools focus on scheduling or basic logistics but lack integrated support for content alignment, speaker prep, and engagement planning.
inputs: Proposed speaker abstracts or talk summaries
Previous seminar feedback or attendee survey data (optional)
outputs: Optimized seminar session agenda with logically ordered talks
Structured speaker briefing documents highlighting key points and alignment with seminar theme
Tailored audience engagement strategy including Q&A formats, discussion prompts, and interactive activities
Summary report with speaker coordination checklist and timeline reminders
whyItWins: Addresses a real, repeated workflow gap not covered by existing tools that focus only on scheduling or broad conference management
Combines content curation, speaker prep, and audience engagement into one coherent workflow
Improves seminar quality and participant satisfaction by making planning more systematic and data-driven
Allows organizers to easily customize based on seminar type, audience, and feedback history

upgradePath.today: A lightweight single-page app that inputs seminar theme, speaker abstracts, and bios to generate a session agenda and speaker briefing summary
upgradePath.in90Days: Add attendee profile input and previous feedback upload to tailor engagement strategies and optimize session flow; introduce calendar integration with reminder notifications for organizers and speakers
upgradePath.in12Months: Develop a multi-page system integrating speaker communication tools, dynamic agenda building with drag-and-drop reordering, attendee interactive features (live polls, Q&A management), and analytics dashboard for post-seminar feedback and improvement tracking

riskNotes: Ensure privacy and secure handling of any uploaded attendee data or speaker personal information
Avoid collecting or inferring sensitive data without explicit consent
Focus on advisory and planning support only; no automated content generation that may misrepresent speaker work
Provide clear disclaimers that engagement strategies are recommendations to be adapted by organizers

blueprint.summary: An integrated platform for academic research seminar organizers to plan and prepare seminar sessions by coordinating speaker content, structuring agendas, and designing audience engagement strategies, evolving from a lightweight agenda generator to a comprehensive seminar management and analytics system.
successMetrics: Reduction in time spent planning seminar sessions
Increased usage of engagement features (Q&A, polls) during seminars
Positive feedback from speakers on briefing documents and coordination
Adoption rate of calendar reminders and communication tools

components.name: User Interface Pages

components.name: API Routes

components.name: Data Models and Storage
components.responsibility: Persist seminar themes, speaker profiles, abstracts, agendas, engagement plans, attendee profiles, feedback data, communication logs, and analytics metrics.

Indexes on seminar ID and speaker ID for efficient queries.

components.name: Background Jobs and Notifications
components.responsibility: Send calendar reminders and notifications to organizers and speakers, process uploaded feedback data for analytics, and generate periodic summary reports.
notes: Respect user notification preferences and privacy settings.

components.name: Third-Party Integrations
components.responsibility: Integrate with calendar services (e.g., Google Calendar), email/SMS providers for notifications, and optionally polling/Q&A platforms for live engagement.
notes: Ensure secure OAuth flows for calendar access.

edgeCases: Uploaded attendee or feedback data contains personally identifiable information without consent.
Speaker availability conflicts that prevent agenda optimization.
Failures or delays in third-party calendar or notification integrations.
Incomplete or malformed speaker abstracts or bios.
Organizer attempts to access or modify seminars they do not own.
Network interruptions during file uploads or background job executions.
Organizer disables notifications but critical reminders are still needed.
nonGoals: Automated generation of speaker talk content or abstracts.
Full conference or event logistics management beyond seminar content and engagement planning.
Collection or inference of sensitive personal data without explicit consent.
Live streaming or video hosting capabilities.
Replacing human judgment in engagement strategy adaptation.

dataFlow: User authenticates via /login page, receiving session token.
Authenticated user creates seminar via POST /api/seminars with theme and objectives.
User adds or updates speakers via POST /api/speakers with speaker details linked to seminarId.
User requests agenda generation via POST /api/agenda/generate using seminarId; server returns optimized agenda JSON.
User views or edits agenda on /agenda-builder page; updates sent via POST /api/agenda/update with reordered talks.
User optionally uploads attendee profiles and previous feedback on /engagement-planner page; POST /api/engagement-plan generates engagement strategy.
User manages speaker communication on /speaker-communication page; sends briefing or notifications via POST /api/communication/send.
User views analytics on /analytics page; GET /api/analytics returns aggregated metrics and charts data.
Background jobs process uploaded feedback data, send scheduled reminders, and generate summary reports using stored data and integration services.
Calendar integration performed via POST /api/calendar/integrate with OAuth tokens for organizers or speakers.
All data persisted in Prisma models with encryption for sensitive fields; versioning maintained for agendas and briefing documents.
validationRules: All API routes require authentication except /login; verify user session and ownership for seminar-related operations.
Seminar creation: 'theme' required non-empty string; 'objectives' optional string.
Speaker data: 'seminarId', 'name', and 'abstract' required; 'bio', 'availability' (valid JSON), and 'contactEmail' (valid email format) optional.
Agenda generation and update: 'seminarId' required; 'talks' must be valid JSON array with talk details including timing and speaker references.
Engagement plan: 'seminarId' required; 'attendeeProfiles' and 'feedbackData' if provided must be valid JSON arrays/objects.
Feedback upload: 'seminarId' and 'feedbackData' required; 'feedbackData' validated for expected survey schema.
Communication send: 'seminarId', 'speakerId', 'messageType' (predefined types), and 'content' non-empty string required.
Analytics retrieval: 'seminarId' required and user must own seminar.
Calendar integration: 'userId' must match authenticated user; 'oauthToken' must be valid OAuth token format.
File uploads (feedback, attendee data) must be scanned for PII and sanitized; reject if consent missing.
Speaker abstracts and bios must be non-empty strings; reject malformed or incomplete data.
All IDs validated as UUID strings or database ID format.
Input JSON fields must be parsed and schema-validated to prevent injection or malformed data.
errorHandling: Return 401 Unauthorized if user not authenticated or not authorized to access/modify resource.
Return 400 Bad Request with detailed validation error messages for malformed inputs.
Return 404 Not Found if seminar, speaker, or other resource does not exist or does not belong to user.
Return 500 Internal Server Error for unexpected failures with logging for diagnostics.
For file uploads containing PII without consent, reject with 403 Forbidden and clear error message.
Handle third-party integration failures gracefully with fallback modes and user notifications.
Background jobs implement retry logic with exponential backoff on transient failures.
Network interruptions during uploads or API calls prompt client retry with idempotency keys where applicable.
Client-side UI displays user-friendly error messages and guides for corrective actions.
Log all errors with context for monitoring and alerting.
securityNotes: Enforce authentication on all seminar-related API routes; verify user owns seminar before allowing modifications.
Encrypt sensitive data at rest, including user credentials, contact emails, and feedback data.
Use secure OAuth flows with token storage for calendar integrations; refresh tokens securely.
Sanitize all inputs to prevent injection attacks (SQL, XSS).
Implement rate limiting on API endpoints to prevent abuse.
Ensure file uploads are scanned for malware and PII; require explicit user consent for sensitive data.
Use HTTPS for all client-server communications.
Store hashed passwords using strong algorithms (e.g., bcrypt).
Respect user notification preferences; allow disabling non-critical notifications but enforce critical reminders with explicit override.
Audit logs for communication sent and data access for compliance.
Implement CORS policies restricting API access to trusted origins.
